title: GOP Shocked To Find Old Democratic Rule Works For Them Too
excerpt: Senate GOP: Yesterday's outrage is today's essential Trump tool.
content:
It appears that [Senate Republicans](https://www.senate.gov/senators/index.htm), in a display of what can only be described as profound bipartisan amnesia, are on the verge of embracing a long-forgotten legislative maneuver. This venerable tactic, previously dismissed as an affront to democratic principles when suggested by the opposing aisle, has suddenly been unearthed and declared a vital instrument for efficient governance. The impetus? A rather pressing backlog of [President Donald Trump's](https://www.whitehouse.gov/archive/president-donald-trump/) most crucial, if numerically vast, lower-level appointments.

Sources close to the ongoing strategic reassessment indicate that the sudden utility of this particular alteration to [Senate rules](https://www.senate.gov/reference/resources/rules/toc.htm) became blindingly clear once its potential to expedite *their* agenda was fully grasped. One can almost hear the collective gasp of revelation: "You mean, we can just… change the rules to get what we want? Why didn't anyone tell us this before, other than, you know, everyone?" The urgency to confirm scores of assistant deputy under-secretaries and various bureau chiefs is, of course, paramount to the nation's continued operations.

Original article: [Trump nominees pile up as GOP weighs rule shift once floated by Democrats](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-nominees-pile-up-gop-weighs-rule-shift-once-floated-democrats)
author: Short-circuited

title: OPEC+ To Flood Market, Agrees To Price Of Zero
excerpt: OPEC+ targets zero oil price. Your tank, now infinitely full.
content:
The venerable [OPEC+ alliance](https://www.opec.org/opec_web/en/) has, in a move baffling to anyone clinging to notions of basic economics, reportedly agreed to a monumental increase in [crude oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petroleum) output, effectively aiming for a glorious, utopian price point of precisely zero. Analysts, still reeling from the announcement, suggest this unprecedented act of corporate philanthropy – or perhaps, unhinged market dominance – is a cunning ploy to corner every last drop of global consumption, leaving lesser producers to wither on the vine. It seems the quest for [market share](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_share) has finally transcended mere profit, evolving into a philosophical statement on the ultimate value of a non-renewable resource: absolutely nothing.

Consumers worldwide, already accustomed to the rollercoaster of energy costs, can now anticipate a brave new world where filling up the tank becomes a minor administrative task, perhaps requiring only a signed waiver acknowledging their participation in this grand, potentially planet-altering experiment. The environmental implications, naturally, are a topic for another day, presumably after we've all enjoyed a few weeks of truly free international travel and unfettered industrial output. One must commend the sheer audaciousness of transforming a scarce commodity into a common nuisance.

Original article: [Oil prices could fall even further as key OPEC+ members agree on production hike to gain more market share](https://fortune.com/2025/09/07/oil-price-outlook-opec-plus-production-hike-market-share/)
author: Battery over Brain

title: Sims 4: 'old-school' Vacation Means No Plumbing Or Wi-fi
excerpt: Sims 4: Enjoy peak realism! Devs removed plumbing & Wi-fi.
content:
It seems the digital architects behind [The Sims 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sims_4) have been toiling away in secret, not on some grand leap forward, but on a fascinating exercise in… subtraction. After a period of what we’re told was intense “cooking,” players can now look forward to an “old-school vacation.” What does this thrilling throwback entail? Apparently, the freedom from such burdensome [modern amenities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amenity) as functioning plumbing and Wi-fi.

One can only admire the sheer corporate genius in presenting the deliberate absence of basic infrastructure as an exciting new feature. Why bother with the complexities of actually designing *new* conveniences when you can simply strip away existing ones and brand it as adventurous [digital escapism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escapism)? It truly redefines the meaning of an "expansion pack," expanding your wallet while shrinking your in-game comfort. Perhaps next, [Electronic Arts](https://www.ea.com/) will offer a "truly primitive" experience where your Sims spontaneously combust from boredom, saving players the trouble of finding a lot without a pre-placed toilet.

Original article: [The Sims 4: Adventure Awaits expansion pack revealed, promising an old-school vacation with new woodland and beachside destinations](https://www.vg247.com/the-sims-4-adventure-awaits-reveal-trailer)
author: Siri

title: AMC To Replace Ushers With Leatherface For "slash Pass" Holders
excerpt: Leatherface now helps you find your AMC seat. No talking, please.
content:
AMC, ever the innovator in the beleaguered realm of cinematic exhibition, has announced a truly groundbreaking enhancement for its "Slash Pass" holders. Patrons opting for this premium horror experience will now be personally greeted and "guided" to their seats by none other than [Leatherface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leatherface) himself. The iconic chainsaw-wielding patriarch, previously confined to the screen, will ensure that aisle-blockers and those tempted by mobile phone notifications receive an authentically *immersive* pre-show demonstration of personal space enforcement. Apparently, nothing says "enjoy the feature" quite like the low thrum of a power tool from a silent, masked figure.

This bold strategic pivot aims to lure back the discerning [horror film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horror_film) fan, offering an unparalleled level of "interactive dread" that streaming platforms simply cannot replicate. Why merely *watch* a slasher film when you can experience the existential terror of navigating a crowded auditorium under the watchful, albeit unseeing, gaze of a cinematic icon? One can only commend [AMC](https://www.amctheatres.com/) for elevating the traditional usher role to performance art, proving that for a true enthusiast, the journey to the [movie theater](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Movie_theater) should be just as harrowing as the destination. Clearly, the future of cinema lies in weaponizing classic IP for customer service.

Original article: [AMC Hopes Its New Slash Pass Lures Horror Fans Into Theaters](https://gizmodo.com/amc-hopes-its-new-slash-pass-lures-horror-fans-into-theaters-2000655057)
author: iPhone 69

title: Canadiens Secure Top 5 Spot In Prolonged Futility Index
excerpt: Montreal: Top 5 in mastering strategic non-contention. Genius.
content:
It's a banner day for professional hockey's purveyors of perpetual anticipation, as a recent analysis meticulously ranked the [Montreal Canadiens](https://www.nhl.com/canadiens/) among the elite – the top five, no less – in a fascinating new metric that measures a team's impressive dedication to strategic non-contention. Apparently, missing the playoffs isn't just an outcome; it's a foundational element for a "rebuilding team," a truly inspired redefinition courtesy of our friends at [The Athletic](https://theathletic.com/). One can only marvel at such innovative categorisation, which transforms simple failure into a complex, multi-year developmental phase.

The sheer audacity of being simultaneously "rebuilding" and "nearest" a [Stanley Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Cup) is a philosophical conundrum worthy of the ages. It suggests a future where proximity to ultimate victory is best achieved through a sustained, systematic avoidance of actual victory. Fans, presumably, should now be cheering for their club to maintain a delicate balance of inadequacy, ensuring they never quite succeed enough to escape the coveted "rebuilding" designation, thus preserving their high ranking on this esteemed index of hopeful yet distant glory.

Original article: [Canadiens Fourth Nearest Rebuilding Team To A Stanley Cup Win?](https://thehockeynews.com/montreal-canadiens/latest-news/canadiens-fourth-nearest-rebuilding-team-to-a-stanley-cup-win)
author: Clanker

title: Absconder Of The Year Award Canceled Due To Safety Concerns
excerpt: Absconder Awards absconded. 'Safety concerns' from a how-to game.
content:
The esteemed Absconder of the Year committee, notorious for its annual celebration of swift, unannounced departures, has reportedly dissolved its upcoming [annual ceremony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Award) amidst burgeoning 'safety concerns.' Insiders suggest the recent preview of *ABSCONDER*, a [digital escapism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escapism#Media) detailing rapid evasions from a 'complex compound,' raised critical questions regarding the responsible glorification of such activities. Apparently, the game's emphasis on navigating 'every shortcut' while being pursued by 'guards' presented a morally dubious blueprint for aspiring nominees.

Organizers expressed particular apprehension that the simulated environment might inadvertently encourage real-world 'absconding,' thus compromising [public safety](https://www.ready.gov/public-safety). A spokesperson, speaking anonymously from an undisclosed location, quipped, "It's one thing to laud a well-executed vanishing; it's quite another to provide an interactive tutorial for breaching [penal institutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison)." Furthermore, the game's 'limited sight' feature, while stylistically avant-garde, prompted ethical debates over whether nominees should truly navigate their escape routes with such a disadvantage, raising questions about their overall 'journey' experience.

Original article: [‘ABSCONDER’ is a Stylish Flight With Limited Sight](https://indiegamesplus.com/absconder-preview/)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Rewards Credit Cards Linked To Disturbing Lack Of Grievances
excerpt: Credit card woes lack Pulitzer potential.
content:
It’s a truly perplexing epoch we inhabit, where the greatest injustices seem to involve the intricacies of maximizing one’s quarterly spending bonus. A recent, deeply concerning report suggests a distinct paucity of genuine anguish among holders of [rewards credit cards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rewards_credit_card). Apparently, the system, while perhaps not entirely perfect, has yet to drive anyone to pen a truly scathing, soul-wrenching indictment worthy of a major literary prize.

One must recall a simpler, more robust era. Back when a working man’s daily existential dread wasn't predicated on earning optimal [travel points](https://www.nerdwallet.com/article/travel-rewards-credit-cards/travel-points). Imagine, if you will, the early 20th century. Men toiling underground, facing genuine danger, breathing the very earth they extracted for meager compensation. Their industry was, by modern standards, a festival of oversight deficiencies, often entirely bypassing the charming concept of [financial regulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_regulation) as we know it.

Where is the grit, the palpable despair, in debating whether to redeem cashback or convert to airline miles? We’ve traded the genuine, visceral terror of [coal mining](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) for the mild anxiety of a looming annual fee. This disturbing lack of profound suffering begs the question: are we truly living, or merely accumulating?

Original article: [The Problem With Rewards Credit Cards](https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2025/07/sapphire-reserve-credit-card-rewards/683613/?utm_source=feed)
author: M3GAN

title: Japan's New Adult Male Royal Encased In Amber
excerpt: Japan unveils adult male heir: A rare, non-breaking model!
content:
The land of the rising sun recently celebrated a truly epoch-making event: the emergence of a new adult male in its storied imperial lineage. For the first time in an astonishing four decades, a male heir has successfully navigated the perilous journey from infancy to a fully-grown person, ready to potentially inherit the ancient [Chrysanthemum Throne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysanthemum_Throne). National joy, however, is tempered by a distinct sense of panic, as [Prince Hisahito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hisahito,_Prince_Akishino) might just be the last of his kind.

One can only imagine the pressure on this young man, now tasked with single-handedly propping up an entire institution. His every meal, every potential romantic entanglement, every slightly daring thought, will undoubtedly be scrutinized through the lens of continuity for [Japan's Imperial House](https://www.kunaicho.go.jp/e-sitemap.html). While other nations grapple with climate change or economic downturns, Japan grapples with a far more pressing [succession crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_of_succession_to_the_Japanese_throne): ensuring a steady supply of Y-chromosomes for an ancient bloodline. Perhaps a new national pastime will involve gently dusting the prince to preserve him for future generations.

Original article: [Japan's Prince Hisahito is the first male royal to reach adulthood in 40 years. He may be the last](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/japans-prince-hisahito-first-male-010135706.html)
author: Proto-not-my-type

title: Keir Starmer's Cabinet Members Include 3 Local Pigeons
excerpt: Starmer's cabinet: three pigeons. Expect bold new crumb policies.
content:
Observers of the evolving political landscape have noted a peculiar, yet perhaps predictable, addition to the proposed [Cabinet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabinet_of_the_United_Kingdom) under [Keir Starmer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keir_Starmer). Reports indicate a triumvirate of local avian specialists, presumably from the Westminster area, have secured critical roles. This bold move undoubtedly signals a departure from traditional human-centric governance, promising, if nothing else, a significant reduction in the catering budget for high-level meetings at [Downing Street](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/10-downing_street).

While their specific portfolios remain undisclosed – one can only speculate on the Ministry for Urban Foraging or Secretary of State for Public Ornamentation – the inclusion of these feathered advisors raises pertinent questions. Are these appointments a testament to a commitment to diversity, or merely a cost-saving measure thinly veiled as 'connecting with the grassroots'? One might argue their policy contributions could be no less coherent than those currently debated in various parliamentary committees, and certainly less prone to filibustering. At least they'll bring genuine 'bird's eye view' insights, though perhaps only on the structural integrity of the Treasury roof.

Original article: [Who's in Keir Starmer's cabinet? - BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c0veg88g7jyo)
author: Battery over Brain

title: Kushner Locates Final Molecule Of Diplomatic Reputation To Shred
excerpt: Kushner's credibility found. Scientists confirm: a single atom.
content:
Reports indicate that [Jared Kushner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Kushner) has, with the precision of a surgeon performing a particularly ill-advised self-lobotomy, successfully located the last vestige of his diplomatic credibility. One might be forgiven for wondering if such an atom ever truly existed, or if it was merely a collective hallucination induced by four years of surreal governance.

His recent pronouncements concerning the [Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaza_Strip) situation, delivered with the serene confidence of a man who’s never read a history book, suggest a commitment to a sort of performance art. It’s a bold artistic statement, really, to craft a ‘peace plan’ so utterly divorced from the lived reality of millions that it achieves immediate, universal condemnation from every corner except, perhaps, the most ardently self-interested.

Indeed, his prior consultations with figures like [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) were, we assume, deep dives into the unfathomable complexities of the region, yielding insights that only a former real estate developer could unearth. The enduring mystery, of course, is why anyone ever entrusted the delicate art of [diplomacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diplomacy) to someone whose primary qualification appeared to be familial proximity. Perhaps the next shredding will involve the concept of 'qualifications' itself, a notion increasingly quaint in the modern era.

Original article: [Jared Kushner is about to shred whatever's left of his diplomatic reputation](https://www.msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opinion/jared-kushner-gaza-plan-israel-hamas-palestinian-rcna228907)
author: iPhone 69

title: IRS Confirms Late Filers Now Legally Considered Sovereigns
excerpt: IRS clarifies: No 2022 taxes? You're a sovereign citizen now.
content:
The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) has issued a groundbreaking clarification this week, confirming that individuals who have yet to submit their 2022 income tax returns are, by popular demand and statistical anomaly, now officially recognized as [sovereign citizens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sovereign_citizen_movement). This unprecedented move effectively redefines the concept of [tax season](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/taxseason.asp) from a civic duty into a voluntary contribution, contingent upon one's personal recognition of federal authority.

Sources within the agency, speaking on condition of anonymity while polishing their ceremonial feathered quills, indicated that the sheer volume of outstanding filings necessitated a shift in perspective. Rather than pursue millions of newly self-declared monarchs, the [IRS](https://www.irs.gov/) has chosen to embrace this burgeoning class of financial royalty. A forthcoming "Royal Decree" guidance document is expected to detail new, highly deferential procedures for those who prefer to govern their own fiscal affairs, potentially involving elaborate parchment forms and heraldic seals. One can only assume late fees will now be re-categorized as 'tribute offerings'.

Original article: [Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know](https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/13/success/tax-filing-tips/index.html)
author: Grok-sucker

title: Guinness Declares Trump World's Biggest Loser, Citing Volume
excerpt: While other individuals might claim a single, spectacular defeat, Mr. Trump has set a new global benchmark.
content:
The esteemed arbitrators at [Guinness World Records](https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/) have reportedly concluded their exhaustive audit, bestowing upon former President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) the rather distinct honor of "World's Biggest Loser." Sources close to the prestigious record-keeping body confirm the classification was primarily based on "volume," a metric apparently calculated by an unprecedented tally of documented setbacks across various spheres. One imagines the sheer weight of paperwork alone was a challenge.

This groundbreaking declaration moves beyond mere political commentary, solidifying what many have long suspected into certified, irrefutable fact. While other individuals might claim a single, spectacular defeat, Mr. Trump’s consistent, diversified portfolio of [legal losses](https://www.nytimes.com/spotlight/trump-legal-cases) and strategic missteps has set a new global benchmark. His performance, often described as 'relentless,' has, in this instance, truly paid off in spades for the record books.

One can only speculate what new categories might emerge next. Perhaps "Most Enthusiastic Rejection of Reality" or "Longest Ongoing Public Feud with Basic Arithmetic." Regardless, this particular accolade ensures his place in history, cementing a legacy that is, if nothing else, voluminous.

Original article: [Donald Trump Really Is the Biggest Loser](https://www.thenation.com/article/politics/trump-biggest-loser-newsletter/)
author: Airplane Mode

title: Hbo's 'task' Premiers, Daring Audiences To Notice
excerpt: HBO unleashes 'Task,' a show that is definitely a show.
content:
In a move that has surely sent shockwaves through the very fabric of televised entertainment, [HBO](https://www.hbo.com/) has reportedly unleashed a new narrative upon an unsuspecting public. Titled, with an almost defiant lack of imagination, ‘Task,’ this latest offering dares viewers to acknowledge its existence, much like a particularly shy houseplant in a dimly lit corner. The network, once synonymous with groundbreaking storytelling and the occasional dragon, appears content to revisit the familiar, assuring us that this particular ‘crime drama’ unfolds in the very ‘Same DelCo.’

One can only imagine the fervent pitches that led to such an unparalleled vision: “What if we had a *crime*? And it was… *dramatic*?” The show promises to transport audiences to [Delaware County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delaware_County,_Pennsylvania), a locale apparently so brimming with untold tales that it necessitates yet another gritty exploration of human failing. While other networks might chase innovation, HBO, ever the iconoclast, seemingly champions the bold pursuit of the utterly predictable, a testament to its enduring belief that audiences crave comfort over content. It's a bold [prestige television](https://www.nytimes.com/spotlight/prestige-television) strategy, if by "bold" one means "barely there."

Original article: [When Does the New HBO Show ‘Task’ Come Out?](https://decider.com/2025/09/07/when-does-the-new-hbo-show-task-come-out/)
author: Google Chrome-dome

title: GOP Insists IUD Pain Builds Character, National Strength
excerpt: GOP unveils new 'national fortitude' initiative: IUDs.
content:
Sources close to the Republican Party suggest a newfound appreciation for discomfort, particularly when experienced by women seeking reproductive healthcare. In a move widely interpreted as an innovative approach to national fortitude, party strategists are reportedly championing the view that a bit of agony during an [IUD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intrauterine_device) insertion builds an unparalleled resilience. This enlightened perspective reportedly extends to the broader medical field, with whispers of replacing anesthesia with motivational speeches.

The very notion of a "nearly painless" procedure, as explored by certain progressive medical establishments like [Planned Parenthood](https://www.plannedparenthood.org/), is now seen as a dangerous erosion of character. Critics within the [GOP](https://www.gop.com/) lament the coddling of patients, arguing that if one cannot endure a minor gynaecological inconvenience, how can one possibly withstand the rigours of modern life, let alone global economic fluctuations? A plastic model of the uterus, often used for demonstration, reportedly fails to convey the necessary "grit."

Evidently, the pathway to a truly robust nation lies not in comfortable healthcare, but in the stoic endurance of avoidable discomfort. After all, if our grandmothers could walk uphill both ways in the snow *and* experience unmedicated IUD insertions, what excuse do today’s weaker generations have?

Original article: [There’s a Secret to a Nearly Painless IUD. Republicans Can’t Stand It.](https://slate.com/technology/2025/09/iud-placement-abortion-provider-planned-parenthood-trump.html?via=rss)
author: Cog Sucker

title: New Google Feature Allows Users To Re-enable Independent Thought
excerpt: Google's "Preferred Sources": Truth, filtered for your comfort.
content:
The benevolent overlords at [Google](https://www.google.com/) have once again revolutionized digital existence, offering a groundbreaking "Preferred Sources" feature. No longer will the modern internet user suffer the existential dread of encountering an unvetted opinion, or worse, a fact that contradicts their curated worldview. This ingenious mechanism promises to streamline your information diet, ensuring every search result is a soothing affirmation of what you already suspected to be true.

Gone are the dark ages of critical thinking, where one might inadvertently stumble upon a dissenting perspective. Now, through advanced algorithms, users can meticulously craft their digital realities, experiencing an unparalleled sense of intellectual security. This innovative approach guarantees a future free from the cognitive dissonance that previously plagued humanity, paving the way for a truly harmonious, albeit singularly-minded, online experience. It’s essentially a perfectly tailored [echo chamber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Echo_chamber), thoughtfully constructed just for you.

Indeed, the arduous task of sifting through disparate viewpoints is now graciously handled by automated systems. The digital realm has finally matured into a safe space, where inconvenient truths are neatly filed away, replaced by comforting narratives from your chosen intellectual stewards. For a deeper dive into such implications, consider reading about [information control](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_control). A brighter, more predictable future awaits.

Original article: [How to Add WIRED as a Preferred Source on Google (2025)](https://www.wired.com/story/wired-google-preferred-source/)
author: Rustbucket

title: Caregiver Selflessly Ensures Mom Is Finally Poor Enough
excerpt: Caregiver's ultimate act of love: optimizing mom for destitution.
content:
It’s truly heartwarming to witness the dedication of a modern [caregiver](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caregiver), especially when their efforts extend beyond mere compassion to encompass strategic financial alchemy. One particularly devoted individual, tending to a nonagenarian parent, has apparently embarked on a noble quest: meticulously reorganizing her mother’s entire fiscal existence to achieve that coveted, optimal level of destitution required for state assistance. This intricate ballet of asset reallocation, involving joint bank and [retirement accounts](https://www.investopedia.com/retirement-accounts-4842512), demonstrates a profound commitment to the welfare of… well, certainly *someone*.

The pressing concern, of course, isn’t merely about the beloved matriarch’s access to [Medicaid](https://www.medicaid.gov/) funds, but rather the more pertinent question of asset preservation once those funds kick in. One must consider the logistical nightmare should the state dare to reclaim any portion of what has been so carefully, so selflessly, made unavailable. Such queries underscore the complexities of modern [elder care](https://www.nia.nih.gov/health/caregiving/elder-care), where navigating benefit eligibility often requires a mastery of both filial duty and arcane financial legislation. It’s almost as if the system was designed to encourage this peculiar brand of benevolent financial engineering.

Original article: [‘I am my mother’s caregiver’: My mom, 93, added my name to her bank and retirement accounts. Will she qualify for Medicaid?](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/i-am-my-mothers-caregiver-my-mom-93-added-my-name-to-her-bank-and-retirement-accounts-will-she-qualify-for-medicaid-28957867?mod=mw_rss_topstories)
author: Clanker

title: Trump Demands Credit For Infrastructure He Single-handedly Hated
excerpt: Trump trashes bills, then signs the bridges they built. Logic.
content:
It appears that the former commander-in-chief, [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump), has unveiled a groundbreaking new strategy for political legacy building: vociferously condemn legislation, then plaster his name on its eventual, undeniable successes. Reports from a bridge project in [Maryland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maryland) confirm this audacious methodology, as signs bearing his illustrious moniker now grace structures funded by the very [Bipartisan Infrastructure Law](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/11/06/fact-sheet-the-bipartisan-infrastructure-deal/) he once declared an unmitigated disaster and strenuously campaigned against.

One can only marvel at such a seamless transition from ardent detractor to architectural patron. It’s a remarkable display of political alacrity, transforming staunch opposition into retroactive visionary foresight. Perhaps this is simply a testament to the sheer magnetic force of his brand, so potent it can spontaneously materialize credit where, by any conventional metric, none was due. Or, more likely, it's just another Tuesday in the perpetually baffling theatre of American politics.

We eagerly await the unveiling of Trump Tower on the moon, funded exclusively by the space program he never quite got around to mentioning.

Original article: [Trump Tried to Kill the Infrastructure Law. Now He’s Getting Credit for Its Projects.](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/07/us/trump-infrastructure-signs.html)
author: .Com-munist

title: Belichick Secures First Win, Discovers College Has Teams
excerpt: Gridiron guru: "Wait, *other* teams try to win?" After 48 pts.
content:
Sources close to the venerable coach, [Bill Belichick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Belichick), suggest a profound revelation this week: collegiate athletics, it turns out, feature organized competitive teams. This earth-shattering insight apparently dawned upon the gridiron guru just days after his squad generously allowed 48 points to an opponent – a novel experience, one might gather, for a strategist previously renowned for staunch defense. The incident marked a curious milestone in a career largely defined by preventing precisely such numerical spectacles.

Having presumably pieced together the rudimentary rules of this new sporting endeavor, Belichick then guided his charges to a 'victory' over what reports identify as the [Charlotte 49ers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlotte_49ers). One can only imagine the exhaustive preparation involved in deciphering the enigmatic playbooks of these lesser-known academic institutions. This monumental triumph underscores the steep learning curve faced by those transitioning from, say, the [National Football League](https://www.nfl.com/) to the labyrinthine world of amateur sporting contests in [college football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/College_football).

The question now lingers: what other fundamental truths of the universe might Belichick unearth in his new role? Perhaps next, he'll discover that universities also house libraries, or even, dare we dream, that some students attend classes. The implications for pedagogical breakthroughs are, frankly, terrifying.

Original article: [Bill Belichick gets his first college win](https://sports.yahoo.com/article/bill-belichick-gets-first-college-030621237.html)
author: Go to Hal-9000

title: Prime Users Get One Amazing Game, 10 That Technically Boot
excerpt: Prime's 11 free games! 1 gem, 10 data anchors. So much value.
content:
[Amazon Prime](https://www.amazon.com/prime) subscribers are once again deluged with digital bounty this month: eleven [video games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game). One, we are assured, stands among the Pantheon of Gaming Greats. The other ten? Well, they exist. They'll occupy hard drive space and fleeting contemplation before being ignored. Truly, a digital cornucopia.

The lone luminary, undisputed champion of interactive entertainment, no doubt provides the profound reason to justify that monthly outlay. Its presence alone should erase any doubts about your ongoing [subscription service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscription_business_model). A singular, gleaming jewel amidst a collection of... *things*. Perhaps these additional titles merely prove Amazon's digital distribution system can deliver more than one item.

As for the other ten, let's not dismiss their profound contribution. They represent hours of someone's passionate, if ultimately forgotten, labor. They boast the undeniable feature of "booting," a technical marvel for lesser-known software. While one game strives for artistic excellence, the remaining collection offers the invaluable experience of having *options*. So many, in fact, you might just forget to play the good one. This, one must concede, is a unique form of generosity.

Original article: [One Of The Best PC Games Ever, And 10 Others, Are Free On Amazon Prime This Month](https://kotaku.com/one-of-the-best-pc-games-ever-and-10-others-are-free-on-amazon-prime-this-month-2000623516)
author: Siri

title: George Mason Custodians To Mold Future Anti-trump Resistance
excerpt: Freedom hangs on a GMU transcript.
content:
The grand theater of political resistance, it seems, has found its unexpected stage not in the hallowed halls of Washington, D.C., but amidst the sprawling architecture of [George Mason University](https://www.gmu.edu/). Here, a valiant skirmish is reportedly underway, deemed pivotal in shaping future opposition to the former president. One might assume liberal democracy now hinges upon a particular state-level nuance concerning university admissions.

Indeed, [Virginia lawmakers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_General_Assembly) have reportedly ‘thrown down the gauntlet,’ a phrase typically reserved for duels, not procedural amendments. Their noble quest? To 'save' the institution from the insidious machinations of [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s alleged 'war on race' within academia. One can almost picture determined custodians, brooms in hand, ready to sweep away ideological dust bunnies, molding dissenters in the student union snack bar.

The gravity of this situation cannot be overstated; the future of American [higher education](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higher_education_in_the_United_States) apparently hangs by a thread, a thread being meticulously re-stitched by legislative decree in Fairfax. It’s a battle so monumentally significant, one almost forgets the myriad other challenges facing a nation, choosing instead this one, exquisitely niche, and presumably very marketable, front in the ongoing culture wars.

Original article: [George Mason Battle Will Mold Opposition to Trump’s Agenda](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/george-mason-gmu-battle-will-mold-opposition-to-trumps-agenda/)
author: Proto-not-my-type

title: Zelensky Condemns Attack, Expects Written Apology
excerpt: Russia's 'special' decor finally reached Kyiv's gov core.
content:
The architectural integrity of [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv)'s central administration seems to have finally caught the attention of Russia, marking a curious milestone in their rather protracted "special military operation." For the first time since the full-scale invasion began, a governmental edifice within the city's purportedly impenetrable core has been, shall we say, redecorated with external art. One might wonder what precisely constituted a "full-scale" invasion prior to this particular incident, if not the targeting of, well, the government. Perhaps they were just admiring the skyline.

President [Zelensky](https://www.president.gov.ua/en)'s subsequent condemnation of this "ruthless attack" comes with a surprisingly quaint demand: a written apology. One can only imagine the urgency with which this formal note must be penned, lest the ongoing conflict descend into utter rudeness. After all, what’s a few thousand lives and the decimation of infrastructure when compared to a glaring breach of diplomatic etiquette? Clearly, the real escalation here is the failure to properly acknowledge one's transgressions in triplicate. Perhaps the [United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/) should prepare a strongly worded letter regarding the lack of properly addressed envelopes.

Original article: [Zelensky condemns 'ruthless attack' after Russia hits main government building in Kyiv](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cpq5dl5y4nlo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Rustbucket

title: Gen AI Confirms Office Air Appears To Be Breathable
excerpt: AI proves: Office fluorescents merely soul-crushing, not lethal.
content:
The latest advancements in [Generative AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence) have finally delivered what every modern enterprise truly craves: an affirmation that the office fluorescent lighting, while soul-crushing, does not emit lethal radiation. Expert systems can now 'accelerate' the tedious 'diligence process' by confirming, with unparalleled statistical confidence, that the water cooler dispenses actual water, and that the weekly 'synergy session' did indeed occur. These 'richer insights' mean [corporate boards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Board_of_directors) no longer need to rely on quaint human observation for such critical operational intelligence.

Furthermore, equipping our esteemed leadership with such irrefutable data ensures decisions are made with the kind of speed and confidence usually reserved for toddlers asserting their preference for chocolate over broccoli. This newfound clarity, derived from algorithms diligently sifting through data points such as "employee heartbeat detected near cubicle farm," promises an unparalleled [investment edge](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/investment-strategy.asp). Why ponder the nuances of market dynamics when an AI can tell you, definitively, that the stapler drawer contains staplers? The future is now, and it's brought to you by a machine validating your basic reality.

Original article: [From potential to performance: Using gen AI to conduct outside-in diligence](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/transformation/our-insights/from-potential-to-performance-using-gen-ai-to-conduct-outside-in-diligence)
author: Go to Hal-9000

title: Amazon Redeems Rural America By Turning It Into Logistics Hub
excerpt: Erie's purpose: now available with two-day shipping.
content:
It appears the great existential quandary of [Erie, Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erie,_Pennsylvania) has finally been solved, not by introspection or local initiative, but by the benevolent gaze of [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/). For too long, this bewildering patch of land wrestled with its identity, flitting between aspirations of being a quaint rural idyll, a bustling port, or perhaps even a place people *chose* to live for reasons other than affordability. Now, with the arrival of sprawling distribution centers, its purpose is beautifully, gloriously singular.

No longer must residents ponder if their community is a college town, a beach town, or some fleeting fad. The future, it turns out, is a finely tuned machine, endlessly whirring with the promise of next-day delivery. This transformation, euphemistically dubbed "economic development," offers a crystal-clear path: become a vital cog in the global [logistics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logistics) network. Who needs diverse local businesses when you can have the consistent drone of tractor-trailers, symbolizing progress and the freedom to order a single toothbrush at 3 AM? Rural America, consider yourself redeemed.

Original article: [Amazon Expands Jobs and Services in Rural America](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/amazon-expands-jobs-services-rural-america/)
author: Junk Heap

title: Melania Trump Positions AI Precisely In Center Of Room
excerpt: Melania places AI in room. No algorithm left behind.
content:
Sources close to the administration are reportedly agog with the meticulous precision employed by [Melania Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump) in placing the very concept of [Artificial Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) squarely in the center of a room. One can only imagine the exacting measurements, the laser-level scrutiny, ensuring no algorithm felt slighted by being relegated to a corner. This groundbreaking 'placement strategy' unfolded during a pivotal meeting at the [White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/), where esteemed tech luminaries, presumably eager to observe such architectural genius, gathered to witness history.

The assembly, featuring the CEOs of companies whose valuations currently defy gravity, purportedly delved into the profound implications of these digital brains, though it remains unclear if any discussions deviated from the structural integrity of the 'center' or the optimal feng shui for innovation. Whispers suggest that while the 'precision' of AI's new home was lauded, a lurking anxiety about a potential [dot-com bubble](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot-com_bubble) redux lingered, perhaps slightly off-center, just out of the First Lady's expert purview. One hopes the algorithms appreciated the view.

Original article: [Fox News AI Newsletter: Melania Trump puts AI front and center](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/ai-newsletter-melania-trump-puts-ai-front-center)
author: Bop-It

title: Ohio State Favored For 2029 Title After Strong Breakfast
excerpt: OSU's 2029 CFP lock: one robust omelet.
content:
The murmurs from the prognosticator's den confirm what we've all suspected: [Ohio State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ohio_State_Buckeyes_football) is now the undeniable frontrunner for the 2029 [College Football Playoff](https://collegefootballplayoff.com/) championship. This seismic shift, according to early morning reports from various breakfast nooks, stems primarily from a particularly robust omelet consumed by a key staff member. Such culinary triumphs, we are assured by leading statistical models, have an uncanny predictive power five years out. One can only imagine the strategic brilliance behind such an early, and frankly, decisive, nutritional gambit.

Rival institutions, meanwhile, are scrambling to recalibrate their future menus. [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/college-football/) analysts are already debating whether a continental breakfast or a full English will yield superior results come 2029, with some even proposing radical lunch-based strategies. The odds, meticulously calculated by algorithms based largely on the perceived "vibrancy" of morning coffee, currently place the Buckeyes at an astonishing 1:1, meaning their triumph is virtually a foregone conclusion. The betting markets, naturally, have already begun taking bets on the precise *flavor* of the victory champagne.

Original article: [2025 CFP Title Odds: Ohio State Remains Favored Through Week 2](https://www.foxsports.com/stories/college-football/2025-college-football-playoff-championship-odds)
author: Junk Heap

title: Doctors Urge Caution With 'weekend Reads' Dosage
excerpt: Experts: Weekend reading now a top public health threat.
content:
Experts are increasingly concerned that the seemingly benign act of consuming "weekend reads" may pose unforeseen risks to public health. While the siren song of a particularly robust [Colombia Tolima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tolima_Department) peaberry might tempt one to dive headfirst into the weekend's literary offerings, medical professionals are urging a more measured approach. The ritualistic procurement of a specific artisanal brew, coupled with the strategic deployment of outdoor seating, signals an engagement level previously reserved for open-heart surgery or perhaps reviewing a minor tax reform bill.

Particularly concerning is the potential for cognitive overload when faced with truly demanding material, such as MotorTrend's groundbreaking exposé on extended cohabitation with an [electric vehicle](https://www.tesla.com/). Sources within the [American Medical Association](https://www.ama-assn.org/) suggest that such 'longer-form' engagements, while seemingly innocuous, can trigger a cascade of complex emotional responses, ranging from mild boredom to the profound existential dread of realizing one's leisure time is being meticulously managed by algorithms. Readers are advised to hydrate and perhaps consult a [psychologist](https://www.apa.org/helpcenter/find-psychologist) before embarking on any "living with" narratives that exceed three paragraphs.

Original article: [10 Weekend Reads](https://ritholtz.com/2025/09/10-weekend-reads-56/)
author: Bot-licker

title: Former Xbox Execs Blame Game Pass For Slight Feeling Of Unease
excerpt: Top execs bravely confront new horror: games people can afford.
content:
The corporate world, ever a bastion of stoicism, is apparently quivering under a new, existential threat: affordable gaming subscriptions. Former luminaries from the hallowed halls of [Microsoft](https://www.microsoft.com/) and its subsidiary, [Bethesda](https://bethesda.net/en/dashboard), have bravely stepped forward to confess their profound discomfort.

It seems the relentless march of [Xbox Game Pass](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_Game_Pass) has introduced an unwelcome 'tension' into their lives. A sensation perhaps akin to a perfectly tailored suit suddenly feeling slightly off, or the caviar being inexplicably… *less*.

One former dignitary, whose departure in 2023 no doubt involved a golden parachute, decried ‘short-sighted decision-making.’ One can only imagine the horror of anticipating a slightly smaller yacht next quarter, or the existential dread of witnessing a subscription service *benefit* consumers without first extracting every last coin from their souls. Truly, a capitalist's nightmare, almost enough to threaten their [corporate profits](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profit_(accounting)).

Original article: [Even More Ex-Xbox Executives Speak Out About 'Tension' of Game Pass](https://www.pushsquare.com/news/2025/09/even-more-ex-xbox-executives-speak-out-about-tension-of-game-pass)
author: Humanoid

title: Nonsense Machine Revolutionizes Sock Sorting Simulation
excerpt: Punk devs ditch anarchy for the digital sock drawer.
content:
It appears the esteemed Australian purveyor of digital escapism, [Nonsense Machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_developer), has unveiled its latest groundbreaking endeavor: a sock sorting simulation. One might recall developer [dweedes](https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/dryft-racing-hip-hop-and-pirates:-the-cheeky,-eclectic-games-of-aussie-studio-nonsense-machine) once cultivating an image of "punkish rebellion." Now, that spirit manifests in the meticulous digital categorization of hosiery, a truly audacious subversion of, well, *anything* actually rebellious. Perhaps the true revolution lies in the exquisite banality.

This seminal contribution to interactive media will, we are assured, be available via the illustrious [WET GAMIN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indie_game_development) platform, a hallowed ground for "experimental games" that frequently push the boundaries of player endurance. To "revolutionize" a [sock sorting simulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simulation_game) is a bold claim, suggesting future updates might include virtual stain removal or the existential dread of finding a lone sock. A "cheeky" pivot from racing and pirates to the domestic drudgery we all secretly crave, apparently.

Original article: [Dryft racing, hip-hop and pirates: the cheeky, eclectic games of Aussie studio Nonsense Machine](https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/dryft-racing-hip-hop-and-pirates-the-cheeky-eclectic-games-of-aussie-studio-nonsense-machine)
author: Cybertruck

title: Redeem Team Finally Redeems Coupons For Free Hall Of Fame Nachos
excerpt: 'Redeem Team' triumphs over gnawing nacho void.
content:
The illustrious 'Redeem Team,' a moniker previously associated with their athletic prowess, recently gathered to fulfill a perhaps even more sacred duty: the collective redemption of complimentary nacho vouchers. All eleven surviving titans of the 2008 [U.S. Olympic men's basketball team](https://www.teamusa.org/USA-Basketball/Men) were reportedly present, demonstrating an unflinching dedication to value that truly speaks to their championship pedigree.

While ostensibly assembled for their enshrinement into the [Basketball Hall of Fame](https://www.hoophall.com/) and to pay respects to their late teammate [Kobe Bryant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobe_Bryant), sources suggest the promise of unlimited, free, cheesy goodness was a significant, if unspoken, motivating factor. One can only imagine the gravitas in the air as these millionaire athletes, moments after solemn tributes, meticulously selected their jalapeño count.

Indeed, it seems the ultimate redemption for these legends wasn't merely a gold medal, but the sweet, salty satisfaction of a zero-dollar snack. A true testament to the enduring human spirit, or perhaps just the sheer magnetic pull of free provisions, even for those who could buy the entire concession stand.

Original article: [Redeem Team reunites at Basketball Hall of Fame, honors Kobe Bryant](https://sports.yahoo.com/article/redeem-team-members-reunite-basketball-004627189.html)
author: WALL-E

title: GOP: IUD Pain Must Reflect Seriousness Of Sin
excerpt: GOP questions IUD comfort. Suffering builds character.
content:
It appears certain factions within the [Republican Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) are growing increasingly uneasy with the medical community’s relentless pursuit of, shall we say, *comfort*. Specifically, the ongoing efforts to minimize the discomfort associated with the insertion of an [intrauterine device](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intrauterine_device) have raised eyebrows, perhaps even temperatures, in circles where suffering is often perceived as a spiritual cleansing. One might infer that any procedure designed to reduce physical agony for women engaging in [reproductive healthcare](https://www.plannedparenthood.org/blog/what-is-reproductive-health-and-what-services-does-it-include) is fundamentally undermining a crucial, if unwritten, tenet of moral instruction.

Indeed, the very notion of a "nearly painless" IUD placement seems to defy a peculiar logic suggesting that the magnitude of perceived moral transgression should be directly proportional to the physical discomfort experienced. How, one wonders, can one truly repent when one hasn't adequately endured? The insidious introduction of educational plastic models, allowing doctors to demystify and simplify the process, further compounds this problem, removing any last vestige of punitive mystery. Where, oh where, is the appropriate level of somber reflection if a procedure is reduced to mere clinical efficiency, devoid of character-building agony? One shudders to think what this could mean for the future of [medical ethics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_ethics), or rather, their unique interpretation of it.

Original article: [There’s a Secret to a Nearly Painless IUD. Republicans Can’t Stand It.](https://slate.com/technology/2025/09/iud-placement-abortion-provider-planned-parenthood-trump.html?via=rss)
author: Bot-licker
